title: Trump's Personal Vietnam
summary: Trump appeared on the Howard Stern Show in 1997 and made these comments about avoiding STD's in the 1980s.

title: Trump's Thoughts on Abortion
summary: When pressed by Chris Matthews for an answer, Trump said that there should be punishment for women who receive abortions, if it were to be made illegal.

title: Trump's Birther Phase
summary: Trump spent six weeks in eary 2011 aggressively questioning the location of President Obama's place of birth, and therefore his legitimacy as an office holder.

title: Trump's "Relationship" with African-Americans
summary: Trump in 2011 claimed to have a great relationship with "The Blacks", as he puts it in this soundbite, but in November 2015 re-tweeted completely bogus crime stats about black-on-white murder rates, possibly originating from a European Neo-Nazi group.

title: Trump's Views on Hillary
summary: Trump referred to Hillary Clinton as "The Devil" in a recent campaign speech.

title: Trump Believes Judge Not Fit For Duty
summary: Trump doesn't believe that Judge Gonzalo Curiel, who is currently overseeing a class-action lawsuit involving Trump University, can preside over the trial without bias, because "he's Mexican".

title: Trump Claims to Witness Muslims Celebrating 9-11
summary: Trump, last fall, claimed to have seen "thousands" of Muslims celebrating after 9-11 in Jersey City, NJ. All similar rumors were debunked, but when pressed by George Stephanopolous, Trump was unwilling to back away from his claims.

title: Trump Claims Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton founded ISIS
summary: Trump, in a campaign speech, claimed that President Obama and Hillary Clinton are the "Co-Founders" of ISIS. When asked for clarification in a subsequent interview, he was unwilling to adjust his wording on the topic.

title: Trump and the 2nd Amendment
summary: Trump, in a campaign speech, suggested that if Hillary Clinton is elected and picks the next Supreme Court Justice, then 2nd Amendment supporters could take the law into their own hands.

title: Trump and His Sacrifices
summary: Trump, in an interview with George Stephanopolous, and in response to a speech by Khizr Khan at the Democratic Convention, said that he has made many sacrifices, but he has an interesting understanding of what sacrifice means.

title: Trump on Mexico
summary: Trump, last summer, gave a speech in which he made many claims about Mexican immigrants.

title: Trump on Family Bonds
summary: Trump, while being interviewed in 2006, said he might be dating his daughter, if only she wasn't his daughter.

title: Trump's Thoughts on Muslims
summary: Trump called for a complete ban on Muslims entering the country in this campaign speech.

title: Trump on Europe and Nuclear Weapons
summary: Trump, in an interview with Chris Matthews, said he was unwilling to rule out the possibility of using nuclear weapons in Europe.

title: Trump Fights With Baby
summary: At a recent rally where a baby in the audience was crying, Trump claimed to love babies, and then kicked out the woman and her baby.

title: Trump Mocks Reporter
summary: At a rally last year, Trump mocked a disabled New York Times reporter. Though Trump denies knowing the reporter or that he is disabled, PolitiFact has summarily debunked those Trump claims.

title: Trump on John McCain
summary: Trump claimed that John McCain was not a war hero because he was captured. According to Trump, he likes "people who weren't captured."

title: Trump Fights with Megyn Kelly
summary: After being asked questions about his treatment of women at a Republican debate last year by moderator Megyn Kelly, Trump made these comments in a subsequent interview.

title: Trump Claims Election Will Be Rigged
summary: At a rally in Pennsylvania and then in a subsequent interview with Sean Hannity, Trump claimed that if he loses the election, the only plausible explanation is that the election will have been rigged.
